derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin vocalis, from vox, voc- (see voice). Current senses of the noun date from the 1920s

entry.tran: 大声说出的;直言不讳的;激烈表达意见的
entry.def: You say that people are vocal when they speak forcefully about something that they feel strongly about.

example.ex: He has been very vocal in his displeasure over the results...
example.tran: 他直言不讳地表达了他对结果的不满。

example.ex: A public inquiry earlier this year produced vocal opposition from residents.
example.tran: 今年早些时候进行的一次公众调查显示居民对此强烈抗议。

entry.tran: 嗓音的;发声的;（尤指）歌唱的
entry.def: Vocal means involving the use of the human voice, especially in singing.

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or designed for or using the singing voice;

sentences.sentence: "organized a vocal group to sing his compositions"

means.word_mean: 2. having or using the power to produce speech or sound;
4. given to expressing yourself freely or insistently;
6. full of the sound of voices;

sentences.sentence: "a playground vocal with the shouts and laughter of children"

stems_affixes.word_buile: equi平等+vocal[adj.声音的;有声的;歌唱的]→两种声音的,听不清楚的→意义含糊的
ir不+revocable可取消的→adj.不可取消的
voci=voc出声,叫喊,看+fer带来+ous……的→带来声音的→喧闹的
advocate拥护+or人→n.拥护者, 提倡者
voc出声,叫喊,看+able能……的→能发出声的→词
vocabul=vocable[n.[无义]词, 词外壳]+ary表名词→n.词汇,词汇量;词汇表
voc出声,叫喊,看+al表名词→n.元音;声乐作品
vocal[adj.声音的;有声的;歌唱的]+ist人→n.流行歌手,声乐家

stems_affixes.value_cn: 职业;召唤;天命;天职;才能
stems_affixes.word_buile: voc出声,叫喊,看+ation表名词→[受到]召唤→天职;职业
vow=voc出声,叫喊,看+el表名词→n.元音；元音字母
con共同+voc出声,叫喊,看+ation表名词→n.召集,会议
ad加强+voc出声,叫喊,看+ate表动词→增强声音→拥护
equi平等+voc出声,叫喊,看+ate表动词→两种声音听不清楚→支吾其词
